evidence: Clear module-based organization in Shadow/modules with numerous specialized files
Separation of concerns with distinct directories for db, services, utils, and Addons
Presence of a single main entry point (Shadow/__main__.py) indicating monolithic structure
Shared database access across modules (MongoDB and SQL) through service layers
Consistent use of dependency injection and service registration patterns
Unified error handling and logging systems across modules
risks: High module coupling through shared global state and services
Potential for circular dependencies between modules
Difficulty in scaling individual components independently
Complexity in maintaining module boundaries as system grows
